column2: inverse problems and the logistic map

column1: After a brief introduction to some practical inverse problems
column2: an outline of Bayesian statistics will be given. The task of validation will be discussed. The connection between conventional inverse problems methods and the Bayesian approach will be indicated. Then a detailed study of the inverse problem on the logistic map will be made. (The logistic map is a simple example of a chaotic system that also finds application as the basis of some random number generators.)
